product_name: Bare Repair Sun + Shade Lawn Treatment + Grass Seed (2-pack)
description:
The bare necessity for cool-season grass

Our easy-to-use lawn repair combines grass seed, slow-release nitrogen, and moisture-holding mulch to thicken thin spots, stimulate growth, and green your lawn. Bare Repair Sun & Shade grows dark green, fine textured grass in just two weeks to help you maintain a more durable lawn resistant to future bare and thinning areas.

sections.faq:
Helpful tips from lawn advisors:
When to plant perennial rye and fescue grass seed?
Seeding and patching should be an annual practice and done as needed to lawns throughout the growing season. The optimal time to apply Bare Repair Sun & Shade is spring and fall when temperatures consistently range between 55 and 75 degrees Fahrenheit.
How long does fescue and perennial grass seed take to grow?
Expect germination in 14 days or less.
Should I use Bare Repair before or after Sunday fertilizer?
You can apply either one first–the order is up to you, and it won’t damage the seed! Since some grass types come up quickly, having some nutrients there can enhance growth.
How to plant bare repair
Prep your soil.
Remove debris and break up exposed soil in bare areas. This ensures seed-to-soil contact, which is essential for the seed to grow.
Spread Bare Repair at the recommended rate.
Spread over patches at a rate of 1 cup per 1 sq. ft. For thinning lawns, apply 1 pound per 15 sq. ft.
Water seeded areas 1–2x daily.
Water in the early morning and evening until grass is about 2” tall. Limit traffic on the newly patched spot until new grass is established.
